titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks MC.227
titlestmt.author: Connor Gaudet

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-06-27 17:59:15 -0400.

change.item: Edited by John Zarrillo for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description
Updated by Anna Bj√∂rnsson McCormick to note that fragile materials are not accessible unless they receive preservation treatment

did.unittitle: Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks
did.abstract: The Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks are a collection of notebooks written by students of Dr. Weisse covering the oral surgery clinics he conducted at New York College of Dentistry. Dr. Weisse was a founding faculty member of NYCD in 1865 and acted as Dean from 1897-1912. The notebooks cover his oral surgery clinics from 1881-1912, with some gaps and some overlaps. This collection will be of great value to anyone interested in the history of dentistry, oral surgery and medicine in general. The case studies provide a look at some interesting cases and are a primary source demonstrating what best practices were considered to be in the field at the turn of the century.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: No discernable arrangement existed prior to creation of finding aid in September 2013. Current arrangement is chronological.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Records of the New York University College of Dentistry (RG 25), Morris Mestel Collection on Saint Apollonia (MC 177), I. Franklin Miller Papers (MC 180)

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. Repository is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open. Some materials in this collection are extremely fragile and require preservation treatment before being served to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks consist of twenty-two notebooks containing notes on oral surgery clinics led by Faneuil Weisse between 1881 and 1912. The clinic notebooks are variously titled as Reports, Records, or Notes, but are essentially all versions of the same "Annual Record of Oral Surgery Clinics" containing details of case studies presented by Professor Weisse at the New York College of Dentistry. Two of them have very peculiar titles; "Styposulphide of Soda" and Inshallah Malaish ( followed by text indicating that this is Arabic for God willing - who knows!) but contain the same type of clinical notes as the other volumes. The notebooks were written by different student authors over the years. Some of the reports are in manuscript form and others from later dates are typed or printed. The topics covered in the clinics range from simple cleft palates to more unusual incidents, like amputating a patient's finger and fusing it to their face in order to create a new nose.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The New York College of Dentistry was founded in 1865 with only 31 students and 10 faculty members. One of the founders and first faculty members was Faneuil D. Weisse, an MD oral surgeon. Weisse stayed on as a faculty member for many years and served as Dean of the College from 1897 - 1912. Weisse passed away in 1915. The school became part of New York University in 1925 and was known as New York University College of Dentistry from then on.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: NYU College of Dentistry's Waldman Library transfered their archival collections to the University Archives in August 2003. The accession record associated with this collections is 03-006.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks; MC 227; box number; folder number or item identifier; Repository Name, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2019 were not recorded. In February 2019 the finding aid for the collection was edited for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description. The title of collection was changed from the Faneuil Weisse Papers to the Faneuil Weisse Collection of Student Notebooks.

controlaccess.corpname: New York University. College of Dentistry

did.unittitle: Series I
1881-82 - "Professor Weisse's Cliniques at the NY College of Dentistry" by Oscar L. Moser
1883-85 - "Notes of Oral Cliniques" by a Senior
1884-85 - "Clinics by Prof. F. Weisse" by F. Heindsmann Jr.
1886-87 - Clinical Record NYCD
1888-89 - NYCD Report of Clinics
1889-90 - Notes on Oral Surgery Clinic - NYCD
1892 - NYCD Clinic Notes
1892-93 - NYCD Clinic Notes
1893-94 - NYCD - Notes on Professor Weisse's Clinic" by C. Radcliffe Haffenden
1897-98 - Report of Oral History Clinics
1898-99 - NYCD Clinics Vol. I - by Clarence Howe
1898-99 - NYCD Clinics Vol. II
1898-99 - Notes on Faneuil D. Weisse's Lectures on Oral Surgery by Charles Gregory Hubbell
1899-1900 - NYCD Clinic
1900-01 - "Styposulphide of Soda"
1901-02 - NYCD Report of Oral Surgery Clinic by Charles Nathan
1902-03 - NYCD Report of Oral Surgery Clinic
1904-05 - NYCD Oral Surgery Clinic Records by Harry Mattiau
1907-08 - NYCD Clinics
1908-09 - NYCD Record of Oral Surgery Clinic - by Adolph Berger
1910-11 - NYCD Report of Oral Surgery Clinics
1911 - Inshallah Malaish (God willing - who knows!)
1911-12 - NYCD Records of Oral Surgery Clinic
